meanings.sent1: The comedian's pasquil about politicians had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper published a pasquil mocking the mayor's speech.
meanings.sent3: The clever pasquil about the teacher's strict rules lightened the mood in class.
meanings.sent4: Her pasquil on social media behavior hit the nail on the head.
meanings.sent5: The pasquil on the school's cafeteria food was so funny, it became legendary.

meanings.definition: A written or printed attack on a person or institution.
meanings.sent1: The scandalous pasquil in the tabloid caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent2: The anonymous author penned a vicious pasquil against the company's CEO.
meanings.sent3: The pasquil on the rival team's coach was harsh but strangely accurate.
meanings.sent4: Her pasquil on the fashion industry's elitism was bold and unapologetic.
meanings.sent5: The political pasquil in the magazine was so scathing, it made headlines.

meanings.definition: To write or publish a pasquil.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pasquil her frustrations in a blog post.
meanings.sent2: The author pasquiled against corruption in his latest book.
meanings.sent3: He pasquiled about the poor service at the restaurant in a humorous way.
meanings.sent4: The journalist pasquiling about government policies stirred up controversy.
meanings.sent5: They pasquiled the unfair treatment of workers in their editorial.
